availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Stanley D. Bowers (Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer and member of provisional government)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer and provisional government representative. Tennessee native. Father of William Bowers. Married Julia Pepper Bowers in Robertson County, Tennessee, on June 3, 1846. Father of Demetrius L. Bowers and Mary C. Bowers. Farmer in Robertson County in 1840. Owned eight enslaved persons in Robertson County in 1840. Farmer in Robertson County in 1850. Owned eight enslaved persons in Robertson County in 1850. Farmer in Caldwell County, Kentucky, in 1860. Employed William Bowers in Caldwell County in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Caldwell County in 1860. Reported as a member of the convention of the provisional government held at Russellville, Kentucky, in November 1861.

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 222B.
